p: The functions of DELs were further explored by performing QTL mapping analysis (Table S3) after the prediction of the target genes of DELs. The results indicated that approximately 37% of QTLs are associated with muscle growth and development (Fig. 5A). We calculated the chromosome distribution of QTLs associated with muscle development were mainly distributed on chromosomes 4 and 6 (Fig. 5B). Interestingly, the top 10 QTLs were associated with muscle development, and were mainly concentrated on the average back fat thickness QTL, waist muscle area QTL and body weight QTL (Fig. 5C). This result speculates that the potential function of DELs may be related to muscle growth and development.
